column2: Revised Safeguards Rule expanded 'financial institution' to include 'Finders' (companies connecting consumers to lenders).

**Consumer:** One-off transaction (Notice only if sharing).
**Customer:** Ongoing relationship (Full Initial + Annual Notices).
Consumers can Opt-Out of sharing NPI with **non-affiliated third parties**.

Illegal to obtain customer info by false pretenses (social engineering). Criminal penalties.
Created by Dodd-Frank. Regulates consumer financial products. Supervises banks >$10B assets.
Unfair, Deceptive, or **Abusive** Acts and Practices.
Materially interferes with understanding terms OR takes unreasonable advantage of consumer's lack of understanding/reliance.
Powerful subpoena power allowing CFPB to demand documents/testimony BEFORE commencing legal proceedings.
Stricter than GLBA. Requires **Opt-In** for non-affiliated sharing and **Opt-Out** for affiliate sharing (unless preempted by FCRA).
Prohibits federal government access to bank records without warrant/subpoena + **notice** to customer.
Must file Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) for transactions >$5k suggesting money laundering. **Strictly confidential** (cannot tell customer).
Requires Customer Identification Program (CIP). Must verify identity (Name, DoB, Address, SSN) for new accounts.
Grants consumers right to access financial data in machine-readable format. Mandates shift from screen scraping to APIs.
